asked the Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs : (a) will he inform this House,- (i) the number of vehicles obtained for the Minister of Home Affairs (non Cabinet) and his personal staff ; (ii) the basis on which these vehicles have been obtained; (iii) out of them, the number of vehicles obtained on hire or contract basis? (b) Will he state in this House from which institutions or individuals the said vehicles have been obtained, along with their names and addresses? (c) will he state separately in respect of each vehicle,-
(ii) the amount of money spent on those vehicles and the amount of money allocated for fuel, monthly and annually?
(i) if drivers had been recruited for these vehicles, the basis on which they were recruited;
(ii) their salaries and allowances? (e) If not, why?

asked the Minister of Rural Industries and Self Employment Promotion : (a) will he inform this House,- (i) the number of vehicles obtained for the Minister of Rural Industries (non Cabinet) and his personal staff ; (ii) the basis on which these vehicles have been obtained; (iii) out of them, the number of vehicles obtained on hire or contract basis?

(b) Will he state in this House from which institutions or individuals the said vehicles have been obtained, along with their names and addresses? (c) will he state separately in respect of each vehicle,- (i) the types of such vehicles;
(ii) the amount of money spent on those vehicles and the amount of money allocated for fuel, monthly and annually? (d) Will he state,-
(i) if drivers had been recruited for these vehicles, the basis on which they were recruited;
(ii) their salaries and allowances? (e) If not, why?

(ii) , ? () 2004 ? () ? () , ? asked the Minister of Livestock Development : (a) will he state this House,- (i) the extent of lands belonging to the National Livestock Development Board and the amounts of tea, coconut and rubber that have been cultivated on those lands, separately according to each District ; and (ii) the number of cattle, buffaloes and sheep that are raised by the National Livestock Development Board on such lands separately, and the total number of animals living on those lands? (b) Will he state the number of neat cattle and oxen provided to farmers by National Livestock Development Board for producing milk, separately, in respect of each District form 2004? (c) Will he admit that the objective of establishing the National Livestock Development Board too was the development of livestock? (d) If not, why?

: : KATUGAMPOLA ELECTORATE : PALLEGAMA ROAD DEVELOPMENT 1176/07 05. ( ) (The Hon. Gamini Jayawickrama Perera) - (1) : () ? () ?

() ? () ? () , ? , : () ? () , ? () , ? () ? () , Asked the Minister of Highways and Road Development : (a) Is he aware that the friendship bridge built across the Ma-Oya which connects Pallegama in the Katugampola electorate and Kotadeniyawa in the Divulapitiya electorate has been bencficial to the transport and economic activities of the people in the area? (b) Will he admit the need for the Pallegama road in the Katugampola electorate, which is an access route to this bridge, to be developed under the Maga Neguma programme? (c) If so, will he inform this House whether allocations have been made and tenders called for the development of this road under the Maga Naguma Programme? (d) Will he state when the development work would commence if allocations for that purpose have been made?? (e) If not, why ?

( ) (The Hon. Gamini Jayawickrama Perera) ? ( ) (The Hon. Jeyaraj Fernandopulle) . : : BALAPITIYA DIVISIONAL SECRETARYS DIVISION : SAMURDHI BENEFICIARIES 1167/07 6.

() ? () , ? asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration, and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order : (a) Will he state in this House the total number of Samurdhi beneficiaries that have been selected from the Balapitiya Divisional Secretarys Division in the Galle District a per the criteria adopted in identifying the new Samurdhi beneficiaries for the year 2007? (b) Will he state the difference between the number of Samurdhi beneficiaries who had been receiving Smaurdhi benefits as of December, 2006 and the number of Samurdhi beneficiaries in the year 2007? (c) Will he state separately the total amount that had been allocated by December, 2006 and the total amount allocated for the year 2007 for the Samurdhi beneficiaries of this Divisional Secretarys Division? (d) Accordingly, if there is a decrease in the amounts allocated for Samurdhi beneficiaries, will he admit that it amounts to a pruning of Samurdhi benefits? (e) If not, why?
() 22.7. 44.5 . 2006.07.07 75 . 2006.09.21 . . : : ELPITIYA DIVISIONAL SECRETARYS DIVISION : SAMURDHI BENEFICIARIES 1168/07 7.

() 2006 2007 ? () ? () , ? asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration, and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order,: (a) Will he state in this House the total number of Samurdhi beneficiaries that have been selected from the Elpitiya Divisional Secretarys Division in Galle District as per the criteria adopted in identifying the new Samurdhi beneficiaries for the year 2007? (b) Will he state the difference between the number of Samurdhi beneficiaries who had been receiving Samurdhi benefits as of December 2006 and the number of Samurdhi beneficiaries in the year 2007? (c) Will he state separately the total amount that had been allocated by December 2006 and the total amount allocated for the year 2007 for the Samurdhi beneficiaries of this Divisional Secretarys Division?
(d) Accordingly, if thers is a decrease in the amounts allocated for Samurdhi beneficiaries, will he admit that it amounts to a pruning of Samurdhi benefits? (e) If not, why?

RECRUIT SOLDIER UDAYANGA, R. .P. H.: RANK 1201/07 11.

asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order: (a) will he inform this House,- (i) to which rank S/162231 R. S., Udayanga R. P. H. was recruited to the Army ; (ii) to which section? (b) will he inform this House- (i) whether at present he is serving in the same section to which he was recruited;
(ii) if not, cannot he be employed in the section to which he was recruited; and, (iii) If the section to which he was recruited has been changed, on what basis it has been done? (e) If not, why?

( ) (The Hon. Jeyaraj Fernandopulle) , , , , . . . Question ordered to stand down. . . . . : . . . . . : M. R. W. P.G. D. WAIDASEKARA : DUTIES ASSIGNED TO THE POST 1256/07 13.

asked the Minister of Cultural Affairs: (a) Is he aware that, (i) Mr. W. P. G. D. Waidyasekara was appointed to a post of Excavations Supervisor, Grade I in the Ministry of Cultural Affairs with effect from 22nd February 1983: and, (ii) he was confirmed in the post of Chief Excavations Supervisor with effect from 01. 08. 1988 and was appointed to the post of

Chief Supervisor of Excavations Division with effect from 01. 01. 1981 and to the post of Chief Supervisor of the Conservation Division with effect from 01. 06. 1996 and to the post of Acting Manager of the Sigiriya project with effect from 01. 01.2001? (b) Will he admit that,- (i) he was transferred to the Jethavana Project after the request for confirmation in the Post of Acting Manager was rejected; (ii) while the duties relevant to his substantive post, the Chief Supervisor, have not been assigned to him, he has been appointed to a post called Maintenance which is not in existence in the institution: (iii) the recommendation made in the ministerial audit report dated 22. 11. 2002 that he should be assigned duties relevant to the post of Chief Supervisor, has still not been implemented; and, (iv) he has received salary increments from 22nd February 1983 up to now without interruption? (c) Will he take steps to place him in the post that should be held by him now in consideration of his educational and professional qualifications, experience and seniority? (d) If not, why?

( ) (Mr. Speaker) ( ) (The Hon. Suresh Premachandran) Hon. Speaker, as far as the ruling party is concerned, they do not have any idea to solve this problem. Within the unitary Constitution they cannot solve this problem and as far as the Tamil people are concerned we are not going to accept anything within the unitary Constitution. If they want to solve this problem, there must be a radical change to the Constitution and there must be a federal system. Until and otherwise, this war will continue and

this Government will not be able to solve this problem. They have to understand this - [Interruption.] This is the problem, Sir. Here, this Minister always makes noises against the United Nations and against all those international organizations. This Government cannot do anything. Actually, they are going to dump this country into the deep sea. That is what they are doing, nothing else - [Interruption.]

. . ( . . ) (The Hon. M. K. Eelaventhan) Hon. Speaker, I rise to a point of Order - [Interruption.] I want to make this very clear - [Interruption.] Does the Government sincerely want to find a solution to this problem? If President Mahinda Rajapaksas Manifesto states that all these problems will be solved within the unitary framework; it will not accept Tamils as an entity; it will not accept the concept of a traditional homeland and it will not accept the right to self-determination; what are you talking? -[Interruption.]
( ) (The Hon. Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe) , -[ ] He must be asked to take his seat now - [Interruption.] ( ) (Mr. Speaker) . [ ] [ ] . .

, "The concept of futurology is an art in political science." .

, Sir, you are a legal luminary. I am an ordinary man. But, how could you be a willing party to raise your hands every month on the question of the Emergency Rules and Regulations which are virtually wiping the Tamil race out of this country , No, no, Mr. Eelaventhan, nothing will happen to you" . Nothing will happen to you, the Sinhalese. But, everything is happening to us. We are virtually wiped out from the face of the earth. ? , ? . , "The Sunday Leader" , I do not see any difference between a unitary Constitution and a federal Constitution - " ; . . ! , , , , ? . " " . The quality of a great intellectual is assertive. But, we find that there are intellectual sellouts, weaklings and collaborators. What more should I add? I do not know. All the adverse adjectives can be applied to the so-called intellectuals in this country. They are a broad ruination to us and to them in turn. , ''

! 1926, "Ceylon is not a country. It is an Island. It is only a rash man who will envisage the merger of the communities , , , , . ? ? ? . . Education is the manifestation of knowledge that is already in you - ." . Here, education is a manifestation. Mark my words. "Education is the manifestation of knowledge that is already in you, says Swami Vivekananda. Here, education is the manifestation of venom and racial hatred of the Sinhala Buddhist priests who are out for our blood in the name of nationalism. There is Sinhala Buddhist imperialism, a disease called imperialism as Ananda Coomaraswamy the great art exponent says. . ', ' ; ' ' . ? ! ! ! ! ! !

, . , " , " , , " , " , , . , ! 175 . " !" . " ! , !" . . . . "They contribute more than 65 percent to the countrys foreign exchange - 65 " , . sub-slavery . ! . . ? ! , ? ? " '' , " , , " ! ! , ." , , , . . , ? ! ! , . ? . , " . , , 55. . ." , . .

. You are determined to see that there should be no emergence of the next generation for the Tamils. It is an unpardonable genocide. I use the words cultural genocide, physical liquidation and economic strangulation of the Tamils. This is what is happening and we will not tolerate this for too long. We have waited, waited for the last sixty years. You spoke of a unitary Constitution. You spoke of a federal Constitution. We were good enough to come down from federalism to regional autonomy, regional council, district council, decentralization and devolution of power. Today also, you were speaking of evolution of power. What I think of evolution of power I stated during my intervention when the learned Hon. Professor was on his feet. President Mahinda Rajapaksa's Manifesto states that everything should be within a unitary Constitution. He does not accept Tamils as an entity. He does not accept the concept of a traditional homeland. He does not accept the right to self-determination. What are you trying to tell us? What is the solution you are going to give? Why do you blame the Opposition? Speak out gentlemanly, as a man with a vision, of what in store for us. You speak of the Indian pattern of federalism. With all our love for India, Indian pattern of federalism is a quasi-federal structure. At any time the Central Government can dissolve any of the States. We are not going to be a willing party to accept anything of this nature. We did stand for a federal Constitution, a meaningful federal Constitution. We did come down for all these things, but we found that they are out to cheat us. We are reminded of the Mahabharatam- , , , , " ! ! . , . . . .
